name: Access
description: Instead of owning a product, customer buys a right to access the product, through rent, etc.
why_it_works: Cheaper, access to products and services that would be too expensive otherwise

bmc_mini.what: Access to something
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Don't need to own the thing, just have access

name: Add On
description: Additional Charge for Extras

bmc_mini.what: Core offering + Add Ons

name: Advertising
description: Value proposition is financed through selling of advertising space

bmc_mini.what: Allow third parties to advertise to your customers

name: Affiliation
description: Support other parties to market their products in order to benefit from successful transactions
why_it_works: Lower CAC by outsourcing sales risk

bmc_mini.what: Support others to sell products
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Access to customers without additional sales, marketing
bmc_mini.unfair_advantage: Large customer base for the affiliate partners

name: Aikido
description: Convert competitors' strengths to weaknesses

bmc_mini.what: Sell something that is different from what everyone else is doing

name: Anticipated Upsell
description: Advertise a price that appears low, counting on the fact that many buyers will spend more

bmc_mini.what: High percentage of buyers ultimately purchase more than they expected. For instance, most new home buyers end up spending 1.2 times the base price of the home after extras. Builders bet on this upsell.
Anything sold as a product
Anything sold as a service

name: Auction
description: Create a community of buyers and sellers by using an auction-type selling process versus a set sales price.

bmc_mini.what: Sell to highest bidder
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Get highest price, be able to influence price of product

name: Barter
description: Products or services are exchanged between people or organizations for products or services in kind
examples: P&G (TV sponsoring in return for advertising)

bmc_mini.what: Exchange goods or services for other goods or services
bmc_mini.cost_reduction: Can save cost because you already have the thing you barter for

name: Bricks & Clicks
description: Extension of in-store shopping to include online ordering with in-store pickup or items found exclusively online.

name: Broker
description: Connect two or more different Customer Segments, e.g. suppliers and buyers, to broker deals

bmc_mini.what: Bring Buyers / Sellers together

name: Bundling
description: Combine multiple products or services together for one single offering

bmc_mini.what: Put multiple offerings together

name: Business Alliance
description: Form a partnership of multiple businesses to mutual benefit, sharing customers, revenues, or data

bmc_mini.cost_reduction: Economy of scale, better use of resources

name: Business To Business
description: Businesses Sell to other Businesses

name: Business To Consumer
description: Businesses Sell to Consumers

name: Cash Machine
description: Coining money with negative working capital - generate revenue faster than you need to pay your suppliers

bmc_mini.risk_reduction: Liquidity, get money first, pay later

name: Cheap Chique
description: Marketing of stylish but inexpensive merchandise. Typically allows for high margins because merchandise sells at low price points but has an expensive feel.

bmc_mini.what: Marketing of stylish but inexpensive merchandise. Typically allows for high margins because merchandise sells at low price points but has an expensive feel.

bmc_mini.notes: Similar to Trash to Cash? Same Category?

name: Collaborative Consumption
description: Create buying power by combining large groups of customers, value to each user becomes higher as more people use it.

bmc_mini.what: Bring buyers together and help buy together

name: Collaborative Production
description: Use Customer labour to create the product

bmc_mini.what: Create products together
bmc_mini.cost_reduction: Reduce need for full production means

name: Collective
description: Similar to a franchise. Involves many businesses coming together for purchasing, marketing, or operational purposes but with looser ties than a franchise. Typically, collectives aggregate buying power and don’t pay ongoing royalties like a franchise.

name: Community
description: Create a space where customers can interact
why_it_works: People like to socialize

bmc_mini.what: Bring people together

name: Cross Selling
description: Offering complementary products and services beyond the basic product or service range, in order to exploit existing customer relationships to sell more goods
why_it_works: Lower CAC

bmc_mini.what: Additional products and services

name: Crowd Funding
description: Oursourcing the financing of a product to the general public

bmc_mini.what: Something to invest in

name: Crowd Sourcing
description: Leveraging users to co-create products and sell to other users.

bmc_mini.what: Unique content, possibility to add content

name: Curation
description: Instead of creating new products and services, find the best or most interesting products and services (or content) to sell

bmc_mini.what: Best collection of content
Analyze customer behavior

name: Customer Loyalty
description: Customers are retained and loyalty is achieved by providing value over and above the basic products or services through incentive based programmes
why_it_works: Lower Churn

bmc_mini.retention: Provide value beyond actual product through incentive based programs
bmc_mini.risk_reduction: Customers are bound to the company

bmc_mini.what: Analyze customer behavior

name: Cut Out The Middle Man
description: Removal of intermediaries in a supply chain. AutoZone bypasses traditional three-step distribution by skipping the warehouse distributor.

bmc_mini.notes: same as direct selling? howeverm as it is worded here it is a BM transformation

name: Digitization
description: Transforming an existing product or service into a digital variant

bmc_mini.what: Existing products and services as digital without reducing perceived value

name: Direct Distribution
description: Separate shipments are coordinated to arrive together
why_it_works: Reduce inventory

name: Direct Selling
description: Bypass the traditional sales channels to target end users. Methods include door-to-door sales and company-owned stores.

bmc_mini.what: Products are not sold through intermediaries
bmc_mini.cost_reduction: Higher margin, cut cost to middle man

name: E-Commerce
description: Traditional products or services are delivered via online channels, removing overhead associated with a physical branch infrastructure

bmc_mini.what: Traditional products and services, delivered through online channels

name: Eco & Green
description: Sell products and services that are eco-friendly

bmc_mini.what: Eco/Green based products and services

name: Experience Selling
description: The value of a product or service is increased by an additional experience offered with it

bmc_mini.what: Add value by great customer experience
bmc_mini.barriers: Unique experience is hard to copy

name: Flat Rate
description: Customers purchase a service or a product for a lump sum and then use it as much as they wish

name: Fractional Ownership
description: Customers purchase only part of an asset rather than its entirety, and thus only have to come up with a fraction of the price

bmc_mini.what: Sharing among group of owners
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Can own capital intensive asset for low cost

name: Franchising
description: Sell the right to use the business model in exchange for a percentage of revenues.

bmc_mini.compelling_reason: F. benefit from brand name, buying power.
bmc_mini.cost_reduction: Local businesses do many steps in value chain

name: Freemium
description: A basic version of the product or service is free of charge, while a premium version is made available against additional payment

bmc_mini.what: Product is offered for free. Typically 8% of users upgrade to become paying customers of virtual goods or to get expanded access.
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Basic = free, pay only when you want to
bmc_mini.revenue: Convert free customers to paying customers

name: From Push to Pull
description: The customer is king, and determines what products and services are created by the company

name: Guaranteed Availability
description: The customer pays for peace of mind, ensured that a service or technical appliance is always available

name: Hidden Revenue
description: The business discovers a revenue stream beyond sales of the original products or services

bmc_mini.what: free or low priced offering
bmc_mini.revenue: Revenue comes from a third party
bmc_mini.value_creation: able to extract value from users

name: Hotel California Model
description: Create a must-have product that traps customers into buying unrelated high-profit items like concessions at a baseball game.

name: Ingredient Branding
description: Branding a product that can only be bought as an ingredient of another product

name: Integrator
description: The company controls most parts of the supply chain, thus reducing delays, costs, and risks

bmc_mini.cost_reduction: Control of most of the value creating process
bmc_mini.notes: Not the same as systems integrator

name: Layer Player
description: Company focuses on one or a few activities in a longer value chain

bmc_mini.what: Supply one value add step in diff value chains

name: Leverage Customer Data
description: Companies that have a lot of customer data can develop additional Value Propositions centering on that data

bmc_mini.what: Preparing cust data in beneficial ways
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Sell data directly or leverage to increase effectiveness
bmc_mini.notes: Form of Epicenter, Hidden Revenue; Data is a resource that can be refined

name: License
description: Create intellectual property which can be licensed to third parties.

bmc_mini.what: Focused on developing intellectual property to license

name: Lock-In
description: Customers are locked in to the vendor's world of products and services in such a way that switching to another provider would incur substantial switching costs

bmc_mini.barriers: Create switching costs based on technology or (inter)dependencies of prod/serv
bmc_mini.notes: Related to Freemium, Razor & Blade, Flat Rate?

name: Long Tail
description: Selling small quantities of a large range of products
why_it_works: Selecting a tiny niche and serving it in ways mass marketers can’t. Hopefully, the tiny niche grows into a much larger one, as it did in the case of Fat Tire beer.

bmc_mini.what: Many niche products
bmc_mini.who: People that look for unique niche products
bmc_mini.revenue: Many small amounts make big revenue

name: Loss Leader
description: This model offers velocity items for a very low margin in anticipation of additional sales at a higher margin.

bmc_mini.what: Extra revenue stream based on using available knowledge/assets in new way
bmc_mini.cost_reduction: Leverage existing knowledge and assets for other companies, reduce slack

name: Mass Customization
description: Customers can customize their product, within specified limits in order to keep efficiency high

bmc_mini.what: Customizable, modular products

name: Multilevel Marketing
description: Leverage friends, family, and other personal networks to recommend products and act as a sales force. Works best for products needing recommendation to facilitate purchase.

name: Network Effect
description: Create a product in which the value to each user becomes higher as more people use it.

name: Nickel and Dime
description: Price the most cost-sensitive item as low as possible and then charge for every little extra.

name: No Frills
description: Value proposition is trimmed down to its minimum, making it cheaper
why_it_works: Customer saves money by not paying for services and products they do not use

bmc_mini.what: Only the bare necessities, basic
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Only what you need at cheap price

name: Open Business Model
description: The business model allows other companies to create additional revenue streams by joining an Ecosystem

bmc_mini.value_creation: Collaborating with partners, cust, suppliers to create value
bmc_mini.notes: ~ Collaborative production? Linked to Collaborative Consumption / Network Effect?

name: Open Source
description: Products are developed by a public community, where source code is openly accessible

bmc_mini.compelling_reason: It's free, you can adapt or change the product
bmc_mini.revenue: Make money on additional services / products (consulting, support)

name: Orchestrator
description: Orchestrator companies focus on their core competences. Any activities in the value chain outside of these areas are outsourced to specialized service providers.

bmc_mini.what: Focus on core comp. in value chain, rest is outsourced / coordinated
bmc_mini.value_creation: Focus on core competence increases productivity
bmc_mini.cost_reduction: Outsourcing, benefit from suppliers' economies of scale

name: Pay per Use
description: The specific usage of a service or product by a customer is metered and charged.

bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Flexibility, even if it means price is higher
bmc_mini.revenue: Pay per use (at a higher price than flat rate)

name: Pay What You Want
description: The customer sets the price to be paid for the product or service

bmc_mini.what: Leads to higher number of attracted customers
bmc_mini.revenue: People decide how much to pay

name: Peer-to-peer
description: Transactions between private individuals

bmc_mini.what: Connect customers to eachother

name: Performance Based Pricing
description: Calculate the price of a product by the services it renders rather than face value

bmc_mini.what: Price is based on the performance rather than physical value
bmc_mini.risk_reduction: Strong integration into value chain of customers

name: Premium
description: Offer high-end products that appeal to brand-conscious consumers.

name: Product As Service
description: Making a product part of a larger service offering.

bmc_mini.notes: Form of Anything As A Service

name: Razor and Blade
description: The basic product is offered for a low price or even for free, but necessary additional products are high-priced
why_it_works: Bait and hook

bmc_mini.what: Consumer purchases a low-margin item like a razor handle or inkjet printer. Sale of necessary consumables such as replacement blades or ink are sold at a very high markup.
bmc_mini.barriers: Technological bind between basic product + consumables

name: Razor and Blade Reversed
description: Initial purchase has a high margin, but consumables are sold at a low margin to entice initial purchase or contrast to razor and blade competitor.
why_it_works: Cheaper over time

bmc_mini.what: High margin product, cheap consumables
bmc_mini.barriers: Technological bind between basic product + consumables

name: Rent instead of Buy
description: Customers only pay for the use of the product, they don't need to purchase it
why_it_works: Access to things you normally could never afford

bmc_mini.what: Customer does not buy, but rents
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Short term: cheaper, don't pay if you're not using it
bmc_mini.revenue: Rent for a specific time period

name: Revenue Sharing
description: Individuals, groups, or companies working together and sharing resulting revenues

bmc_mini.what: Created value is shared with other stakeholders

name: Reverse Engineering
description: Analyze a competitor's existing product or service and use the learnings to develop a similar product

bmc_mini.what: Reverse engineer a competitor's product
bmc_mini.risk_reduction: You know the product works and has a market
bmc_mini.notes: Is this one of the 'black hat' models? Parasite, Symbiont, ...?

name: Reverse Innovation
description: First produce for the developing world, then repackage and resell to industrialized world
why_it_works: To be successful in developing countries you need to be very competitive, which means a large opportunity for margin

bmc_mini.what: Simple, inexpensive products from/for emerging markets sold in 1st world countries
bmc_mini.risk_reduction: Product is already viable at lower margin

name: Robin Hood
description: The product is priced differently for different customer segments
why_it_works: Selling the low price high volume version creates opportunities of scale, margin comes from the high price version

bmc_mini.what: Same product sold to the rich and the poor
bmc_mini.revenue: Price depends on market (rich vs poor)

name: Self Service
description: Part of the value creation of a product or service is handed over to the customer
why_it_works: Large savings potential, customer labour replaces staff positions

bmc_mini.what: Part of value creation transfered to customer
bmc_mini.value_creation: Remove steps that create little value but are expensive
bmc_mini.cost_reduction: Reduce cost by having customer do steps in value creation themselves

name: Service As Product
description: Standardizing a predetermined bundle of services typically bought together and selling for a fixed price similar to a product. Many times it includes an element of flat-fee pricing as well.

bmc_mini.what: Productized
bmc_mini.notes: Similar to Anything As A Product

name: Shop-In-Shop
description: Establishing an independent store in another company's retail space
why_it_works: Lower CAC

bmc_mini.what: Use a partner to integrate the company's offering into
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Host: more attracted customers, more variety, constant revenue (rent)

name: Solution Provider
description: Total coverageof products and services in a particular domain, consolidated in a single source

bmc_mini.what: Total coverage of products in a domain in one single point of contact
bmc_mini.barriers: Customers can get everything in one spot
bmc_mini.risk_reduction: Prevent revenue losses by extending service
bmc_mini.notes: Similar to 'One Stop Shop', but in one category

name: Subscription
description: Receive products or services regularly, for a recurring price
why_it_works: Recurring revenue.

bmc_mini.what: Access to product or service
bmc_mini.notes: Similar to Guaranteed Availability? Flat Rate?

name: Supermarket
description: A company sells a variety of readily available products under one roof

bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Everything in one place, Great variety of products, convenience

name: Systems Integrator
description: Combine partial products into one complete offering
why_it_works: Reduce risk, cost, increase flexibility

name: Target the Poor
description: Tailor products and services towards the bottom of the pyramid customers
why_it_works: There are billions of customers

bmc_mini.what: Offer service normally offered to premium cust to base of the pyramid

name: Trash-to-Cash
description: Recycling and reusing old waste products and materials to create new products
why_it_works: Zero purchase cost

bmc_mini.what: Used products, refurbish, or relocate

name: Two Sided Market
description: Facilitate interaction between two (or more) complementary groups for mutual benefit
why_it_works: One group of customers gets access to another group of customers

bmc_mini.what: Multiple interdependent groups of customers
bmc_mini.value_creation: Let more groups of customers interact
bmc_mini.notes: Same as Multisided Market, similar to shop in shop (virtual), affiliate

name: Ultimate Luxury
description: Focus on customers in the top financial bracket to sell exclusive products and services at a premium price
why_it_works: High margin, low competition

bmc_mini.notes: Opposite of Target the Poor, form of Premium

name: User As Expert
description: Gives users access to technology and tools typically reserved for company employees. Users then create their own designs or versions of the product.

name: User Designed
description: Customers act as both consumers and designers of products and services
why_it_works: More variety in design, lower cost

bmc_mini.what: Customer is both manufacturer and consumer
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Able to realize entrepreneurial ideas without needing infrastructure
bmc_mini.notes: Same as Crowdsourcing? Similar to Mass Customization

name: Virtual Economy
description: Sell virtual goods online
why_it_works: Very cheap to produce, very high margin, lock in

name: White Label
description: Products are not specifically branded, but are sold by other companies under different brand names
why_it_works: Different price brackets for the same product, low CAC (third party), low branding cost

bmc_mini.what: Other companies distribute under their brands
bmc_mini.risk_reduction: Reduce dependence on 1 brand / marketing strategy

name: Zero-Touch Implementation
description: Business models that deliver measurable value without requiring any internal organizational change from the client
why_it_works: Eliminates change resistance, reduces risk, appeals to traditional businesses

bmc_mini.what: External systems that improve business performance without internal change
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: No disruption to existing operations, guaranteed no internal change
bmc_mini.who: Change-resistant businesses, traditional organizations, family businesses
bmc_mini.channels: Conservative business networks, traditional industry associations
bmc_mini.revenue: Performance-based fees tied to external improvements
bmc_mini.notes: NEW: Addresses 68% of traditional businesses requiring no-change solutions

evidence: 68% of traditional businesses require no-change solutions
Change resistance is primary barrier to business improvement
External overlay technologies enable value without disruption
sources: F&B Business Model Pattern Gaps Research 2025
Harvard Business Review change management research

name: Cultural Chameleon
description: Service models where external providers adapt to family business culture rather than requiring cultural change from the family
why_it_works: Builds trust through cultural respect, creates loyalty, preserves family values

bmc_mini.what: Adapt service delivery to client's family culture and values
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Respect and preservation of family heritage and culture
bmc_mini.who: Family businesses, multi-generational companies, cultural organizations
bmc_mini.revenue: Premium pricing for cultural expertise with loyalty relationships
bmc_mini.unfair_advantage: Expertise in family business cultural adaptation
bmc_mini.notes: NEW: Addresses 40% loyalty advantage with cultural fit approaches

evidence: 40% higher loyalty with cultural fit approaches
Family businesses represent significant market segment
Cultural preservation critical for family business success
sources: Montana State University family business studies

name: Certainty Guarantee
description: Service models with specific 6-month ROI guarantee timeframes addressing conservative business psychology
examples: Rapid cost reduction with guaranteed outcomes
why_it_works: Addresses conservative business need for certainty and quick proof

bmc_mini.what: Guaranteed measurable ROI within 6 months or full refund
bmc_mini.compelling_reason: Certainty and quick proof for conservative businesses
bmc_mini.who: Conservative businesses, traditional organizations, risk-averse decision makers
bmc_mini.engagement: Regular milestone reporting and progress tracking
bmc_mini.revenue: Success fees with majority contingent on 6-month outcomes
bmc_mini.unfair_advantage: Risk reversal credibility in conservative markets
bmc_mini.notes: NEW: Specific 6-month timeline addresses conservative business psychology

evidence: Traditional businesses require certainty and quick proof
Conservative market needs specific timeline commitments
Risk reversal psychology effective for traditional buyers
